page.title: 09Sawston/Babraham Education
page.content: In 1924{Henry Morris}outlined plans to recast the rural elementary school system. The building of{Sawston {Village College,}begun in 1928 was the first school to offer its educational facilities to the community as well as to its pupils. It was opened by HRH the Prince of Wales on Oct. 30 1930.It was a senior school for 250 pupils aged 11 to 14 yrs. drawn from Sawston and the surrounding villages.In 1974 the College was offering fully comprehensive education for 1300 boys and girls aged 11 to 16.So Henry Morris's scheme was brought to reality. In 1985 the school has 1335 children taught 79 members of staff. At present children wishing for a 6th form education have to travel out of the village. The small village of{Babraham}has one school for children from 5 to 11.
